description: Circular primes (numbers that remain prime under cyclic shifts of digits).
comments: The next repunit that is prime has 317 digits, all ones.  See A004023. - _Harvey P. Dale_, Mar 22 2012Only the smallest member of the cyclic shift is listed. See A068652 for all members. - _Chai Wah Wu_, Nov 09 2015
links: K. S. Brown, On General Palindromic Numbers
mathematica: fQ[p_] := Module[{b = IntegerDigits[p], ps}, ps = Table[FromDigits[b = RotateLeft[b]], {Length[b]}]; If[p > Min[ps], False, And @@ PrimeQ[ps]]]; Select[Prime[Range[100000]], fQ] (* _T. D. Noe_, Mar 22 2012 *)
crossrefs: Sequence includes all prime repunits (A004023). Cf. A003459.
For a sequence listing all the prime-yielding cyclic permutations see A068652.
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_
extensions: One more term from _Lekraj Beedassy_, Nov 07 2002
